### Description

If you have a button containing only an icon then it will be square.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a button containing only a single icon
2. Add the .is-rounded class to this button

The button shape is a circle.

### Actual behavior

The button shape is oval.

Issues.Title: [Help needed] color name set in $custom-colors does not overwrite name in $colors
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.0] My **browser** is: Firefox Dev Edition I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**. ### Description The following code does not overwrite the `primary` color values set in `$colors` ([source1](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/ef1e4513fbaac9af5a82dccaa58c3f394a882540/sass/utilities/derived-variables.sass#L103), [source2]()). Is that correct or should it overwrite the `primary` color values set in `$colors`? `my-custom-variriables.scss` ``` @import '~bulma/sass/utilities/initial-variables'; @import '~bulma/sass/utilities/functions'; @import '~bulma/sass/utilities/derived-variables'; @import '~bulma/sass/utilities/mixins'; $primary: blue; $primary-invert: findColorInvert($primary); $primary-light: findLightColor($primary); $primary-dark: findDarkColor($primary); $custom-colors( 'primary': ($primary, $primary-invert, $primary-light, $primary-dark), ) ``` ### Steps to Reproduce 1. add `$custom-colors` with a custom `primary` color 2. compile your styles 3. create a test element `
Some text
` ### Expected behavior The text color is `blue`; ### Actual behavior The text color is `hsl(171, 100%, 41%)` (Bulma `$turquoise`) ## Workaround Copy the complete Bulma's `$color` after setting the variable that needs to be `// customised`: ``` $colors: mergeColorMaps( ( 'white': ($white, $black), 'black': ($black, $white), 'light': ($light, $light-invert), 'dark': ($dark, $dark-invert), 'primary': ($primary, $primary-invert, $primary-light, $primary-dark), // customised 'link': ($link, $link-invert, $link-light, $link-dark), 'info': ($info, $info-invert, $info-light, $info-dark), 'success': ($success, $success-invert, $success-light, $success-dark), 'warning': ($warning, $warning-invert, $warning-light, $warning-dark), 'danger': ($danger, $danger-invert, $danger-light, $danger-dark), // custom color copied from below to work 'new-color': ($new-color, $new-color-invert), ), $custom-colors ); // Note: This still does not compile and needs to be copied into $colors $custom-colors: ( 'new-color': ($new-color, $new-color-invert), ); ``` The same with `$shades` and `$custom-shades`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Help needed] color name set in $custom-colors does not overwrite name in $colors" (#3139)

Issues.Title: updated notification javascript guidelines
Issues.Body:
This is a **documentation fix**.

### Proposed solution

The 'notification' component JavaScript Example does not work when there are multiple notifications present within a page as the $notification variable is not scoped. This allows the closing of one notification, and all the subsequent ones do not close as the $notification.parentNode reference no longer exists.
This can be solved by adding a simple var statement in front of the $notification variable. Such a solution would have saved me a lot of time (and many unsuspecting future users) as it is not trivially identified, hence making it significantly easier to use this component.

### Testing Done

None.

### Changelog updated?

No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "updated notification javascript guidelines" (#3132)

Issues.Title: Question: Negative Margin in Titles?
Issues.Body:
This is about Bulma

I have a question

### Overview of the problem

It turns out that Bulma uses negative margins in at least two places, namely the title and subtitle classes that are not also "is-spaced"

Negative margins raise all sorts of alarm bells in my head, as I learned that the only time to use them is if you want to overlap a div with a previous div - which I doubt is the goal when using titles and subtitles?

I know I can just override the variable, but why was this choice made, and is there no better solution? 

We stumbled across this when adjusting the header sizes in our derived theme, and were wondering about this when our headers suddenly started overlapping.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Question: Negative Margin in Titles?" (#3123)

Issues.Title: BUG: White strip on the right hand side on mobile
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

It's a bug that occurs on most browsers I've tested (Chrome Desktop/mobile, Safari IOS, Firefox mobile, but not Firefox Desktop).
<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** 
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.8.0]
My **browser** is: Chrome for Ubuntu (Desktop)
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
<!-- I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? -->

### Description

On mobile, there is a white gap on the right hand side of the screen. It looks like the bug is related to Bulma (and not my code), because I have found it on lots of sites made with Bulma including **bulma.io** (!) itself. Here are some examples:

![Bulma.io](https://i.imgur.com/I8ZmqH5.png)
![Other](https://i.imgur.com/qR9taRg.png)

You can see that I'm using the default zoom (100%).

### Steps to Reproduce

The problem seems related to the `columns` element. It has a margin of -12px on the right and removing it seems to solve the problem, but it also creates unwanted side effects (changes the alignment of the page). There should be a better way to solve it than changing Bulma's default properties.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BUG: White strip on the right hand side on mobile" (#3122)
